definition: abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin

sentences.english: At the brand new Starbucks store a long queue of people spilled onto the street.
sentences.chinese: 人們把嶄新的星巴克大門圍得水泄不通。

sentences.english: And the first time I saw my cousin Tony's brand new Firebird.
sentences.chinese: 是我第一次看到表哥託尼的嶄新的“火鳥”車。

sentences.english: They've replaced most of the old looms with brand-new ones imported from the States.
sentences.chinese: 他們從美國進口了一批嶄新的紡機來替代那些舊的。

sentences.english: Vous Mirror is a refreshing take on the design of a mirror.
sentences.chinese: 您的魔鏡就是這樣一個對於鏡子嶄新的設計。

sentences.english: A new cassette recorder recorded their love swear.
sentences.chinese: 一臺嶄新的盒式磁帶錄音機記錄下他們愛的誓言。

sentences.english: He's going to have a new look.
sentences.chinese: 他將會有一個嶄新的面貌。

sentences.english: Electronic literature transmis sion service is a complete new mode of literature resources sharing in the inf or-mation era.
sentences.chinese: 電子文獻傳遞是信息社會對文獻資源共享的嶄新模式。

sentences.english: This shining, un-used day will bring.
sentences.chinese: 這燦爛，嶄新的一天即將獻呈。

sentences.english: This year the event will be held in the brand-new Kodak Theater.
sentences.chinese: 今年的頒獎典禮將在嶄新的柯達劇院舉行。

sentences.english: At the end of the weekend, the man handed her 10 crisp $100 bills.
sentences.chinese: 週末結束時，該男子遞給她10張嶄新的百元大鈔。

sentences.english: The lawsuit of the public benefit is becoming a brand-new hot topic in both jurisdiction and law.
sentences.chinese: 公益訴訟是當前司法界和法學界一個嶄新的熱門話題。

sentences.english: A lovely couple presides over this spick-and-span operation.
sentences.chinese: 一對可愛的夫妻操持着這一嶄新的設施。

sentences.english: Virtual reality will be the new form of education and entertainment.
sentences.chinese: 虛擬實境將是教育及娛樂這兩方面的嶄新形態。

sentences.english: It seemed that Shanghai has turned on a brand-new look.
sentences.chinese: 看起來，上海已打開嶄新的面貌。

sentences.english: It will merely take them longer to understand a new way forward.
sentences.chinese: 這隻會使他們花費更久來理解面前的一條嶄新的道路。

sentences.english: The buildings are new and short and lack speciality and cultural atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 校園建築嶄新卻低矮，沒有特色，缺乏文化氛圍。

definition: to create/to bring about/to produce/to set (a record)
to stand out from the masses (idiom)
to pass through/to penetrate/by means of/via
to crane one's neck/to await eagerly/to lead/to show the way
auxiliary verb introducing future action: may (be able to)/will (cause)/should (enable)/going to
to belong or be dedicated exclusively to/proprietary/private/personal
innovation/to bring forth new ideas/to blaze new trails
to break new ground (for agriculture)/to open up (a new seam)/to develop (border regions)/fig. to open up (new horizons)
to put to use/to apply/practical/applied (science, linguistics etc)/application/practical use/(computing) app
